description: Contracted from Scots jillet (“a giddy girl, a jill-flirt”).

entries.meaning: A woman who jilts a lover.
examples: And has she been long a Jilt? has she practiſed the Trade for any Time?

verbs.description: jilt (third-person singular simple present jilts, present participle jilting, simple past and past participle jilted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cast off capriciously or unfeelingly, as a lover; to deceive in love.
